reviews.review_msg: She explains concepts clearly and records lectures. Her midterm and final are very fair. She always explains concepts and answers questions thoroughly. Group assignments and quizzes are clearly explained and easy to do. One of my favourite profs at Beedie!!

Lectures are easy to follow and cover everything you need to know for assignments and exams. She managed to make statistics engaging and fun. Lectures are recorded.

She was very knowledgeable and helpful with any questions. Quizzes and assignments were generally straightforward and easy if you pay attention to the content. Overall great class.

Good lectures that are easy to follow, but they're not applicable to the quizzes, assignments, or midterms because she makes the content significantly more difficult for those. Question prompts are unclear and there are a lot of assessments and assignments compared to other courses. 30% of your grade comes from group work, so choose carefully!

her lectures are so easy and the assignments are so hard that you can barely use her lectures to supplement and do the assignments. Have a topic on our midterm that we didn't even get to learn yet in class? Her practice midterm questions are also much harder than the lectures as well so have no clue what to expect with exams

Honestly a solid professor. Lectures were recorded for convenience and participation was rewarded. My biggest gripe is that the course is heavily backloaded: A midterm, 2 quizzes, 3 assignments, a report and a hackathon. The first half only had 1 quiz, 1 assignment and 1 midterm. The pacing of the class hurt the quality.
Very kind and answers every question students have during the break. Mayyyybee an occasional typo in slides.

Outstanding professor who goes the extra mile to ensure her students understand concepts. She shows how concepts can be applied to various facets of life. She is approachable and truly cares about her students. If 232 was a nightmare for you, she will change your entire outlook on stats with 336.
Nice professor, fair exams. Group assignments are not really difficult.
Best Prof, actually cares about students and wants them to succeed. Exams are extremely fair.

I had a rough time with BUS232 so I dreaded this class. However, Negar made BUS336 so enjoyable, I never thought I'd have a fun time with statistics. She is extremely clear with explaining the concepts and grading policies. She essentially tells you what will be on the quizzes and exams which makes studying very efficient. Would take again.

I was very nervous to take BUS 336 because I had a very bad experience with BUS 232, but Negar made my nervousness go away so fast! She's an amazing lecturer who uses a lot of examples in class to make sure you understand the material, she is so approachable, and helpful if you ever need any extra help. I would take her class again in a heart beat.

Had her for bus 232 last semester and bus 336 right now. Negar is one of the best professors by far at SFU. Fair exams, tells you what exactly is on the exam, and opportunities for bonus marks. Though, if you're not strong in Excel, try to familiarize with it. I never learned so much Excel but it was extremely useful as an accounting major.
Such a caring prof that tries her best to make sure everyone understands. Provides lots of info to prepare for exams.

I had an awesome experience taking 336 with Negar. Everything you need in a prof, transparent with grading outlines, recorded lectures to review content, clear explanations. Very practical class also if you want to refine your Excel and data visualization skills. Overall a very caring and knowledgable professor. HIGHLY recommended.

The nicest prof I have ever had. Had her for BUS 232 and 336 and I learned so much in both. She is the only prof I have had to be so open to questions and going the extra step to help students. She also sent us canvas messages telling us how we are such smart students before the midterm :') she is literally so nice and fair with grading

Professor Negar is such an amazing human. You can go to her with any questions you have and she will take the time to answer it thoroughly, ensuring that you understand. She is so caring and her lectures were helpful
Negar is very kind and is always willing to help her students if they have questions. Her exams are fair and she only tests on things she has taught. Highly recommend.
She is amazing. You are having any difficulty reach her out. She wants her students to pass the course. Slides could be a little confusing somethings. Want more caring professors like her in SFU.

I had an awesome experience taking 336 with Prof. Ganjouhaghighi. Everything you need in a prof, transparent with grading outlines, recorded lectures to review content, clear explanations. Very practical class also if you want to refine your Excel and data visualization skills. Overall a very caring and knowledgable professor. HIGHLY recommended.
Really good at explaining concepts and always gives helpful answers to questions asked about materials/assignments. Fair exams based on lecture material. Very kind person and good lecturer.

Took her course in early 2022, she never recorded her lectures which was tough when reviewing material. She also had no idea what was going on while teaching, often taking breaks or ending class because she couldn't figure out the material herself. If you wanna pass you should prob show up to class otherwise you will be behind.
She kind of struggles clearly explaining concepts in class but the exams are really fair.

Negar was a pretty good lecturer, especially given it was her first time teaching BUS336. The exams are pretty straightforward and closely related to lectures. During lectures, you will do a lot of Excel/Tableau, which is really useful but isn't tested. Assignments are done in groups but can be a bit vague and challenging, so ask THE PROF questions

Lectures were quite boring, but it's stats which makes it hard to blame that on her. She is a very genuine person and wants her students to succeed. Group assignemnts frequently needed further explanation, but midterm and final was quite fair and representative of the course.

Her lectures were straightforward and she was clear when explaining concepts but some concepts could've been explained in more detail. Group assignments were a little confusing but exams were very fair based on what you learn in class.

Really nice and fair. Nothing surprising for the exam questions or the assignments. Explanations during lectures may sometimes be confusing but there is a lot of material to cover so she goes by them quickly to make time. Accessible outside class and good at answering questions 1-on-1.

The TAs were rude and unhelpful. The (online) exams were run poorly. The exam questions had mistakes making the questions logically impossible. All of the lectures were prerecorded YouTube videos, so I'm not sure what George was doing all semester. Would avoid if possible, but if not it's just one course.

DO NOT TAKE THIS PROF! I basically just self study the whole semester while trying to figure out how to do question from other ppl's youtube videos. He just read off the slides on his ppt and didnt even explain the concept. His assignment are difficult and I have to spent like 10+ hours on it every week because he cant teach.

If you are good at teaching yourself off of youtube videos with no professor interaction this professor is for you. I had troubles understanding the concepts but clearly youtube does not reply to you when you ask a question. Professor was absent all semester long and refused to reply to emails over the term. I cant believe SFU allows such behaviour

I taught myself this course from his youtube videos that were recorded in May. Half the time I didn't know where the answers were coming from as he was not there to answer my questions. This course definitely requires more interaction but the way this prof does it he is never present on email or canvas or lectures. Go a different route.

This class is basically teaching yourself off of youtube videos. The professor is absent all semester long and refuses to reply to your emails. The TA Ben is also very arrogant and is useless as he does not make any sense. There is clear evidence the class cheats and has academic honesty issues. Choose a different Prof, this is not worth it!

He doesn't teach. All the lectures are pre recorded from a few semesters ago. He literally just reads off the slides. It's so obvious that people cheat in the class. In-person 336 average was 63%, and and online the midterm average was 82%. How is this remotely fair? Embarrassed to be paying this much money for such poor quality of education.

Forough Pourhossein is truly a inspirational role model. She makes learning fun and enjoyable. Love how she checks in on the class during lectures to see if students understand the content/her explanations as well. Wish she taught more courses at SFU. Enroll in her classes and you will definitely not regret it.

You're in good hands if you choose Forough as your instructor. She creates a class environment where students feel motivated and enjoy learning. I've never seen a professor provide more office hours than she does. She goes above and beyond to care for and support her students. She is the PERFECT example of what a professor should do, act, and be :)

She is a nice and caring prof. But at times she lacks clearly explaining concepts. Most of the semester we had to reverse engineer her examples in lecture as the majority of the class did not understand. Sometimes her lectures can feel scattered and disorganized. Taking this class you will have to teach yourself a lot of the material.
Learned everything myself, she seems nice but didn't teach that well.

Wish she gave more time for her final as it was stressful. Students have other exams too and are probably gonna think slower than she expects. Would of been helpful if split her exam into 2 timed modules. 1 for MC and 1 for problems so students can track time. Also prevents students from randomly guessing MC to move on to problems worth more marks

Amazing prof and nice but her final was structured awfully. Made final intentionally long so has wiggle room to adjust grades to curve but having 30 min more would have been nice. Looking back at exam questions at the end were easy and could of solved them if given more time. She should scramble the MC and long answer next time to better gauge time

Was an amazing prof! For a stats class, she made the content very clear. Lectures are content heavy and there are tough assignments throughout the term, but she is always available for help, and gives hard assignments so we do well on exams (which she makes very easy and straight-forward). Learned a lot in this class!

As someone whos bad at math. This is a really challenging course for me. But Im glad I met her. If there is something I dont understand, I can get just watch lecture recordings, or go to the labs and office hours. This is a challenging course unfortunately :(, but as long as you are willing to work hard, you can do okay :).

Prof Pourhossein is one of the most caring teachers I have ever met in my past three years of university life. I had never received solutions from my previous teachers at 1 AM but prof Pourhossein did. She is so caring to students and understands the student. I just cant express how much I love her!!!!!

Firstly this is no pop quiz. Secondly, She said before midterm do not use chegg, and if you use you will get low grade or report to school. Thirdly, for the last assignment 6( total 6 assignment, 5 out of 6 will be count for grade), you do not need to do assignment 6. Lastly, This is a lot of excel files and she use it for teaching.

Forough is a really nice prof that is caring and accessible. Exam is really fair that is completely based on the lectures&assignments. This is a relatively hard course but if you put effort into it you will definitely get good grades.
She is always willing to help. This is not an easy course. She make it so much better.
great prof. Wish her teach more course at SFU.

Forough to be a really nice prof, understanding, and very accessible outside of class. She provides extra office hours to ensure that students can ask questions. BUS 336 is a challenging and heavy course, so be prepared to rewatch some lectures and make notes outside of class. Attendance is required bc of iClicker qs. Overall, I enjoyed her class.
If you DO study her lectures, it is doable. Her assignments and exams are fair.
Good prof
Great prof assignments help you learn concepts and exams are fair

1. She is always late. 2. She does not explain the concepts clearly, Youtube is a better teacher. 3. Her assignments are difficult. Everyone uses Chegg 4. Her practice midterm was not related to the actual one. 5. She does not care about students, her email reflects greatly.

Take BUS 336 with Forough Pourhossein! She is the BEST professor in Beedie (I wish she taught all the BBA courses). Her lectures are engaging and interesting. Attend her office hours, as she is very caring and accessible (offers additional hours if needed). She literally does not sleep, so students do well, I've had my emails answered at 3 or 4 am.

The best prof i had by far. She wants all her students to succeed and is very accessible. She always welcomes students to attend his office hour. She comes to class prepared with a detailed PowerPoint. Her lectures are very understandable. Her assignments are relatively easy if you pay attention to his lectures.
Worst professor.

Very engaging class. People worry that this course is similar to 232 but it's a lot more practical and interesting. He doesn't respond to emails and defers questions to TAs but is accessible during office hours. 

Get your hands on the test bank and solution manual. The midterm and final have 40 MC questions and 90% of them are from the test bank.

I really love Frostlord's BUS 336 class. He is chill, casual, and hilarious. I have taken him twice for 232 and 336, and I understand he is very formula heavy in 232 BUT this will make 336 much easier when you have understand the foundations in 232. I really enjoyed his 336 class and I would say it is fairly easy to excel. 10/10 would take again.

He is content with catching every cheater out there so be prepared for many inconveniences. Post lecture quizzes, weekly assignments and individual assignments are helpful and not hard to complete if you pay attention in lecture and read through his slides a couple times. He responds to all questions and is an enjoyable lecturer to listen to.

Andrew has an obsession with catching cheaters, going to extreme lengths to hinder student accessibility. Be prepared for an abundance of homework, quizzes, and assignments. There is no feedback given for homework or assignments which makes it hard to prepare for exams. Furthermore, Andrew's attitude with students is unemphatic and arrogant.

Please avoid him at all cost if you dont want to mostly be tested on theories/concepts that are of no practical value! His questions dont truly reflect the students understanding and application of the materials as it is heavily based on terminology and theory. Stat course but mostly no calculation questions tested so only memorizing could help

horrible class. have to get 50% on an arbitrary section of the final to pass the course regardless of how you did elsewhere. I have never put so much time into an assignment before and they're only worth 5%. prof is convinced everyone in the class is a cheater waiting to be caught.

Took both 232 and 336 with Flostrand. He's super into the material and explains everything very thoroughly. He'll check if anyone has questions on topics before moving on. The open labs with the TAs are suuuuper helpful and if you go there for help regularly, you will get an A! Fair exams and assignments.

I learned all of my practical Excel skills from him. The TAs are really helpful so definitely ask for their help. Most people didnt do well on the written part of the final because they didnt practice with Excel enough (he clearly stated there would be Excel on final tho). Just do some self-practice with Qs from textbook and you should be fine

Andrew is an interesting guy. Has ten "team based learning" exercises throughout the course for credit, but they really help to grasp the course concepts. Midterm is all MC so has a high mean. For the final all you have to do is know his slides and be familiar with the LP models and formatting them in Excel, and you will be fine.

Frostlord is one of the best lecturers at Beedie. Time flies in his class with his ability to incorporate humour into his lectures even in the most dry and comlex topics. Very approachable and personal. Both 232 and 336 are 4 credits and makes you work! Fall behind? Good luck. Start his assignments the night before the due date? Don't even bother.

Andrew is an amazing teacher! I took buec 232 & bus 336 with him and learned the concepts so well and gained practical skills! He is truly a gem, and if you are interested in quantitative analysis courses, he is your guy!

I really wanted to like Andrew in 336 as much as liked him in 232 but to me, he was just disorganized in his lectures and didnt explain things deep enough. It was bad enough that we used excel in lectures but stuck to pen and paper in exams, but did he really have to make the finals 60% and nitpick the topics we were tested on?

I found Flostrand to be quite disorganized in an overall decent class. Participation and homework assignments take up 20% of the course and require a lot of legwork. His expectations for exams are unclear, but if you leave yourself a decent amount of time for the final (60%), you can do well. Note he is probably the alternative for 336.
Organized, clear, fair, and amusing.

Definately one of the better profs for this course. Assignments require quite a lot of work but are only worth 5% each. First Lectures and then tries providing time for his students to practice on Excel. Walks around and helps! Midterm was easy and avg was high, final was fair and avg was 70. Overall hes funny and his class is a treat. I recommend

Frostlord was a great prof, one of my favorite at Beedie, and I'm happy to have taken 336 with him. His teaching style is superb as he is aware of "tough" concepts and makes concepts as easy to follow as possible. He also finishes lectures early. Assignments do require a lot of work for little reward. Midterm average was 85, Final was in the 70's.

Andrew was a better prof for Buec 232. He made Bus336 a lot more confusing than it is, jumping between teaching applications on excel QM and regular excel, both of which will not be used on exams- Many students don't how to study for exams. Assignments require a lot of work with unclear grading scale, & lecture contains unhelpful group work.

Andrew tries to be funny and light during lecture. Try to listen in class. He is pretty clear on his powerpoint and give lots of relevant examples so no need to read the text. Content is pretty easy to understand. Overall, a fun class with a great prof!

I dont think anyone would dislike Andrew, unless youre dumb and cant keep up with his method of teaching. I like him because he makes you work for it, and those who actually put in the effort get what they deserve. Would take any course he teaches in a hearbeat

I took both 232 and 336 with him and I was not disappointed! He is a great guy, chill personality, excellent at explaining concepts! First time teaching 336, some flaws but tried his best to help us out, Ive never seen a prof walk around the class so much to help students! And he makes hilarious jokes! Overall perfect!

Flos God is the best BUS 336 professor that uses a hands-on approach to learn through Excel. The puts in a great deal of time to help you (individually) troubleshoot your Excel and make sure you understand. Grab this meme lord for your prof or wait till he teaches the next semester. Flos or nothing !(btw no better 336 profs)

Expects everyone to self learn R studio which isn't even a preferred coding language nowadays. Makes the course unnecessarily harder for no absolute reason. She is very passionate about computer sciences and coding but again this is supposed to be a business course!? Take it with a prof who teaches the course on excel.

Disappointed the course changed from Excel to R Studio. As a business class, I expected Excel skills with real-life use. R coding has little relevance for me and there was limited practice. The practice midterm did not reflect the real one. Many group projects, but you choose your group.

Do not take BUS336 with this professor. Students in 336 with other professors only use Microsoft Excel to compute statistics, but she expects us to learn R and Tableau almost completely independently. Her midterm review has calculational and writing mistakes. They do not correlate with her slides or what she thought in class. Don't take this prof!

horrible prof. expects you to know how to code right out the gate. midterm and the review includes concepts that were not covered or barely touched on in class. you basically need to teach yourself anything, and instructions arent really clear for assignments. also could not schedule office hours with any of her TAs.

Get ready to teach yourself everything, including how to code in R. This course should absolutely have tutorials and recorded lectures because the pace is way too fast and the instructor assumes you know everything so she just jumps into complex material. Overall been a horrible and very confusing experience.

Eman definitely is not the best professor in terms of punctuality and charisma. However, the tradeoff here is that her class is far easier than a lot of other professors. On one hand, there's a prof in which you have to pour hours into assignments worth nothing, while the other prof can barely teach, both of which are for the Burnaby campus.

These other reviews are tripping. Emans 336 is miles easier than any other prof at SFU. Sure, she isnt the best teacher, but in terms of workload and exam difficulty she is by far the best. Super high averages on every midterm compared to other 336 profs. Generous grading. She is an extremely kind an approachable prof. She made 336 a breeze.

She is never on time for class. Mostly upsetting how students have tried to educate her on certain topics but she did not want feedback. For example, was under the impression that she did not need to curve??? Also that she could pick which campus to make us write exams?? This prof is very unprofessional andan embarrassment to the business faculty!

Bad lecturer. Wants students to come up to the board and write answers? Information learned wasnt very useful because she doesnt apply the concepts to real world examples XD. Bad attitude to want to help a student who is asking

She has poor attitude towards student concerns in class and just shrugs it off. She has kahoot quizzes in class each worth 1% but barely gives us enough time to read the question let alone answer the question (the questions are not clear btw). The class has not felt productive so far. She was also not aware that Beedie classes need to be curved.

THE LECTURE IS AT SURREY CAMPUS, BUT SHE WANTS ALL THE CLASS TO GO TO BURNABY CAMPUS TO TAKE ALL THE EXAMS???? AND I BELIEVE SHE IS THE ONLY PROF THAT USE EXCEL FOR ALL THE EXAM FOR THIS COURSE. SHE DOES NOT KNOW WHAT SHE IS TEACHING. BEING LATE FOR EVERY CLASS, NO BREAK, AND ALWAYS DELAY TO DISMISS THE CLASS. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS WITH HER.

Worst prof ever and disrespectful to students. I had a horrible family emergency and he didnt care; he wouldnt defer my final exam. I had to go to the Associate Dean and then he budged. Went to see him in office hours and he was so rude to me and about my personal life that I ran out crying. This is a fact. He also cant teach to save his life.

By far the worst I've ever had. His lectures are pointless - but he does random pop quizzes so you have to show up, but bring something else to do, he doesnt explain it well enough to be worth your time. the textbook will help you pass.

Amir was the worst professor I ever had, he was disrespectful to students and is very poor at lecturing. I self learned all the material for the course. I speculating he may have wrote the previous 3 good reviews he received as the language used in all 3 and ideas are similar and close to what he says in lecture. Midterm and final are fair.

he is one of my fav prof in sfu. He is really passion and willing to help student to understand of each single topic. There are pop up quiz and of course we need to come to class. The midterm is fair and average was high. BUS 336 is stuff course, a lot data and calculation. Review on BUEC 232, it will help in this course

He is passion professor and he is willing to help if we are confusing. The average midterm was high because it was not tricks. There are 3 pop up quizs, dont skip class. Read over slide, textbook and often come to lab, your grade will be on the top.

Amir is a really passionate professor. He makes sure that every student understands each topic. Averages for all graded submissions were quite hig because he pulls no tricks and the exams were overall fair.

by far the worst prof i have ever had, could not understand a single word he is talking about and the lecture is boring, you only need to attend the lecture because of the popup quizzes, and it's just worthless to attend. completely waste time at all. don't take this class
Without a doubt the worst prof I've had at SFU. No idea what he's saying, and midterm instructions are unclear. Avoid at all costs.
Don't bother showing up for lecture. You won't understand a word he's saying.
By far the worst prof I have ever had. Was extremely repetitive and was difficult to understand. Had no ability to explain any concept and in my opinion should not be teaching at a university level.

The strategy to this course is really to finish reading the chapter every class and do the example questions in the chapters and from his annoucements. His lecture expects students to pre-read before class, and he connects the knowledge gaps not covered in textbook. He can be repetitive. Final was tough but scale was advantageous to students.

Okay prof, but very repetitive. The midterm average was very high, but the prof posted the grade distribution early on,  which is probably why the final average was so low. Obviously, the entire class wasn't going to get an A.

Aside from being difficult to understand, Amir's lectures were extremely repetitive & hard to follow. Only reason to attend was b/c of his 2 pop quizzes, which he may give after the break. Assignments were lengthy & not marked consistently. Extremely misleading to students - midterm had an avg of 83 and final avg was 34. My advice? Avoid this prof.
Read off slides. Midterm was extremely easy but Final was horrible (MEAN  34/100)  Long Assignments. TAs are not helpful too. Read the book and u should be fine, except the Final.
worst pro I ever had

He is SO repetitive, it's like listening to a broken record for 2 straight hours. No joke. Just read the textbook, it's way more efficient. That aside, it wasn't hard to get a good grade. Assignments are pretty long though. Midterm was fair, final was easy. If know how to use Excel this class will be a breeze.
He is vague and hard to follow. He is irresponsible for his works and marking scheme.

Two pop quizzes for the term so you have to show up in class and see if there is a quiz. Really hard class to listen in a lecture setting since there are a lot of excel stuff. Amir was really hard to follow as well. Had a hard time to understand him so got sleepy pretty often in his class. Midterm and final are fair as long as you do your assignmen

The textbook is your best friend. Reads off PowerPoint. Extremely repetitive. Does not give hints as to exams/quizzes. Only reason to go to class is not to miss the pop quizzes. His lectures are dreadful and he has a very annoying voice that after an hour you can't help but lose interest. Wouldn't recommend.
Very smart

The worst lecturer I ever had at Beedie. Literally talks over his slides and then makes you sit in groups and "do the examples". When I would go to labs he would tell us to ask the T.A.s only and that he only helped with theory. This is because he had no idea what the hell was going on with the exams.   Terrible teacher, avoid at all costs.
The course was practical, and I enjoyed attending his lectures! The assessment and overall mark were satisfactory, although the exams were challenging. He is lacking in responsiveness to emails!

He 100% writes his own reviews. All the bad reviews are completely accurate. He doesn't teach anything. The averages are around 40%. He blames the class for the low averages. This class felt satire. Just don't do it!!!
He makes the topics easy to understand, I really enjoyed taking this class with him.

Overall, a somewhat nice and pretty funny guy. Midterm was bad, but final was a lot easier, mainly because out of 5, the first 3 written questions were copied word for word from the midterm, and the fourth question was word for word number for number copied from the last assignment. He should provide more practice problems to help students learn.

yall im being so deadass when i say avoid unless your amazing at teaching urself. everything we learn in class is using excel&tableau software but the exams are only handwritten and he doesn't teach u how to do anything by hand u learn on ur own. also doesn't provide any sample questions that reflect the only handwritten method all of them use exel

He does not know how to teach. Gives no problems or homework to practice for midterms and exams- was so lazy he gave everyone automatically 10% for an assignment he didn't post. You will have to teach yourself everything. All work we did was through Excel and on midterm he expected us to calculate by hand, never teaching us how to.
does not know how to use a computer.

Honestly, the content for this course is not hard, he just teaches it awfully. The midterm average was 41%, with the best mark around 75% in a class of 200 ppl. No practice questions, he pushes back everything, doesn't answer questions properly and teaches terribly. (I did good on the exam so I am not writing this out of spite).
Mehdi please do not pretend to be a student and rate yourself 5 here, you know you don't deserve it

I'm kinda blown away by some unfavorable comments, all because the midterm was a letdown! although some of the questions were basically copy-pasted from the assignments. Accustomed to detailed exam instructions, challenging questions lead us to blame. But honestly, Mehdi's a cool, smart teacher, totally the right person for this course.

Avoid this man at all costs. He takes a second to look at his slides, then proceeds to "explain" them to the class by reading word for word off of the slides. It's almost as if he's learning the concepts along with the class:) He also doesn't know how to project his voice and gets too lazy to hold the mic up so no one can hear what he's saying.

Dear Mehdi,

I hope this comment finds you bad. You are the worst.

Best,

Your 336 Student

This guy has many jobs at the same time and professor is just one of his job. He has a HUGE PROBLEM with his TIME MANAGEMENT. 
Mehdi, I don't know if you see the comment here. But please! If you cannot manage this, just do not be a professor! Do not waste our tuition! Do not destroy our lives! You have a serious problem with teaching!

Never in my 4 years of uni have I witnessed a 40% EXAM AVG, especially in a class of 200+. Exam was pushed back a week already, 1-page formula sheet was allowed, and an extra 20 mins was given halfway through the exam. 

dawg this should be the moment for serious reflection as a professor lol

sweaty ah classroom, could smell everyone's pit sweat.

Knowledgeable, hilarious, easygoing, and punctual professor. The midterm included a few questions identical to the assignments, yet we did not expect coding in the exam. The course focuses on applied analytics using Tableau/Excel, yet the exam needs to be on paper, making it challenging to practice for. Overall Mehdi is nice professor.

Midterm was way too easy, I almost passed (average was 40%). 

If it wasn't for the 30 degree room making me delusional mixed with terrible teaching I may have actually learned something. He also doesn't understand his own slides and acts as if he's seeing them for the first time. Overall great prof! (Avoid at all costs)

Do not take this class. The professor is always late to class and told us that the textbook was examinable and most of the questions were from course lectures. He literally had us handwrite tableau code for the exam. Not enough coursework to learn the materials properly. Midterm average was 40% and he ignored our feedback.
Good teacher, engaging, and you actually learn real-world skills. The multiple-choice questions on the exams aren't as straightforward!

He arrives late almost every day, and is often late to release assignments, giving us less time to do them. It's like he's seeing his powerpoints or videos for the first time and he has to verbally decipher them (which takes a while) during the class. Doesn't allow students to email him. Speaks very quietly and is hard to understand.

Accessible prof not by email but by his phone number. He was late to class by 10min once and was pretty apologetic about it. He cares enough about his class that he would consider our opinions about certain questions and adjusted the final questions on the exam to better align with what we learned in class.
He is very good. I like him

He puts little to no effort into this class. He uses the slides that the textbook provides and refuses to post lecture recordings. He was 15-20 minutes late for every lecture.There was one question on the midterm that was not covered in the class and the highest mark for that question was 3/12. He refused to drop the question.
He is a great teacher. Knows the contents well and he makes sure you get them! I have learned so much in his class.

Mehdi is a very kind and intelligent man. He is open to questions and good at clearly explaining concepts. I really appreciate the time he took to teach us Tableau as it is an incredibly useful tool. Mehdi have been a wonderful professor and I hope that many others follow suit in going to extra mile to teach us relevant information.

2 days before the final exam changed it from take home to in person. changed the schedule and duratin of exam about 5 times. really boring and dry lectures. says lectures are optional but theyre clearly mandatory and refuses to post recordings. really messed us up when he changed the final exam format 2 day before the final. avoid at all cost.

Decided 3 days before the exam that it would be a take-home that was outside the scheduled exam time, then changed it back to in-person the day before the exam. Incredibly unorganized, was behind the syllabus the entire semester so students never knew when things were due. Was late to every lecture and gave very unclear criteria.

Not a good lecturer, mostly repeats whats on the slides and does Excel examples, and talks very quietly and holds the mic at weird spots so its hard to hear him most of the time. Spends a lot of the class teaching tableau, being the only prof for this class that does. Doesnt provide practice questions even though its so excel-heavy.

I could not imagine how he could be so effective. He changed my mind to choose the concentration in Operations Management, provided examples in a straightforward and easy-to-understand way, and the exams are just that. (P.S.: You do not need to practice a lot to get good grades.) I LOVE his courses.

He is unorganized and his exams don't follow the textbook, but he makes up for it with his thorough explanations and examples. Very accessible outside of class, willing to stay up rather late to answer student's questions. Understanding if you made a mistake and are willing to make an effort to improve.
Boring class Boring exam Unfair at all

Good professor with an impressive work history. He is very different from other profs as he is not a career instructor, and he comes directly from the industry. He spends a lot of time on practical applications in his class, which is vastly different compared to how other professors teach it. If you study hard, you should get an A+.

This is my third time as a TA and I was rather disappointed by the disorganization between Nate and his students. The work he goes over in class generally differs from whats typically taught normally, so students will often have a difficult time if theyre not used to it. Nate delays his lectures half an hour so him and students can sleep in.

Despite being very dedicated to the study of Statistics, the ease of the exams makes the curve extremely high. The average for our final was over 90%, and with the course average being so high, some in the class got a C despite getting an 80% overall. Nate neglects to check emails, will often use Wikipedia in lectures, and always starts 30 min late

Nate is an amazing professor. He wants students to succeed and cares deeply about them. Sometimes I found him going too fast during lecture. He has a lot of industry experience. Workload was manageable, but midterm 1 was way too tough. Difficulty level of final exam & midterm 2 was lower than midterm 1. Assignments were doable as well.

Definitely a inspirational professor that tries to make sure his students have PLENTY of time to learn and finish assignments. Sort of lazy since none of exams or assignments are actually made by him. They are all taken from online or a book. Midterm 1 was just time constraining otherwise not too hard. Final was essentially midterm 2 and other Qs.

Went into the course with a very optimistic attitude, but was disappointed to find the course to be exactly the opposite. Grades too easy, class average on midterm was 91, the curve is way too high. Has sporadic office hours, most of the time hes late for. Caring, and has excellent industry experience, but just not yet ready for academics

Nate cares so much about his students and will do whatever it takes to see everyone succeed. If you go to class and put in the effort, you will do well. Little unorganized but overall, a very knowledgeable prof.

Gave us 2 days to study for the midterm. Frequently delays assignment release dates, to the point where he had to scrap an assignments and push the grade value per assignment up. Delays releasing the review forms until after an easy second midterm to boost opinion in the class. Attend office hours for more clarification on class content

Nate is the nicest guy but he is extremely unorganized. Attending lecture is mandatory because he speaks so fast and if you simply look back on his notes after the fact, they'll make little to no sense. He holds many office hours but the line is always an hour long because no one understands what is going on. Doesn't prepare us for exams enough.
Good prof

He goes way too fast in lectures. I see many students recording the lecture. In his office hours, there's a long line because nobody understands what to do in his assignments. The TA's aren't helpful. The midterm is on paper, but in more than 80% of his lectures he uses Excel. Then he gives us Wikipedia screenshots to study for the midterm.
Very knowledgeable about statistics and willing to help his students. Can sometimes be disorganized.

Reliance on Wikipedia in most lectures is questionable. Postpones assignments and midterms regularly. Office hour availability is random and inconsistent. Does a lot of work showing how to use Excel, even though only tested on interpretation of data. Delays lectures half an hour on average. Knowledgeable, has extensive industry experience.

gives good feedback and revised marks for the assignment he thought he marked us too hard on. He knows the material is hard so he spends lots of time going through assignment questions. Allows ensures that we are informed of changes happening. Very enthusiastic about what he is teaching. He is a very smart guy.
clear about what he wants in the exam, very attentive, always stays behind class and during breaks, very informative about whats going on in the class and when his office hours will be

Routinely starts lectures 30 mins late. Assignments are weekly, but often delayed. Midterms constitute a significant chunk of the grade. Tends to go off on tangents while answering questions. Refers to Wikipedia as a reliable source, check it for a refresher or supplementary information. Unclear walkthroughs on assignment questions.

Your grade is made up mainly of your two midterms and the final. Teaching is mediocre at best as he does not have a lesson plan. Tries going over questions from textbook that will have loads of mistakes. Enthusiastic about what he does but teaching ability is not there, with many assignments being delayed since some people in class didn't get them.

He does no have a clear rubric and seems flexible, but he was not. He deducts marks if you don't have a good format. He kept sending us at least 2 emails per day. Some "good" day, you will receive 5 emails from him about all the assignments and his office hour. He sent emails to everyone even if he leaves his office.

He spends classes doing problems, but he's working through them for the first time himself and gets confused. When someone asks him a question, he spends 10 minutes going on a tangent while not answering the question, usually opening some Wikipedia articles on the way. He also sends several emails a day, half of which are about BUEC instead of 336.

He is a friendly teacher and very smart. His office hour is very helpful and tries to help as much as students he can. However, he made lots of mistakes in the class and messy notes. Even if a similar type of questions, sometimes he uses different templet for that. He made lots of questions in the first midterm and no one submits in advance.
Nice prof and TA, you will be find if you attend the lecture every week and go to the open lab weekly.

Her lectures are very thorough and she makes sure that students understand the topic. She even omitted some sections of the course because she would spend extra time explaining topics that she believed students needed help on. Her exams are very fair, and I never had to look at the textbook, the lecture slides were enough.

Don't take Bus 336 with her. She does not know how to deliver course material to the class and you will end up self-teaching. She doesn't go over any questions during class that could help with the assignment. Going to open lab saved me. If I solely relied on her lectures and teaching I would have done even worse on the assignments and exams.

I took this class with Ron in 2000. Ron is one of the best professors I've met in either undergraduate or graduate school. He's helpful, funny, humane, extremely smart, and a wonderful role model for anyone pursuing an academic career.
Ron is helpful and although he teaches stats he's great :)

Ron did a good job in teaching the insanely boring in Linear Programming/Statistics.   He was a bit unclear at times, but was open for help if you called him.   Having taken much harder Stats courses before, I can honestly recommend him as he is friendly & helpful.

You should take it with Ron. He is a great guy. He waits for his students if they are not understood and even if you dont get the concept, he will repeat the same thing in a big lecture room. Slow paced but fully understood stuff. I attended lecture all the time and had so much fun with Ron. Take it with him!
He's a good guy but his way of teaching is a lil bit weird...exam qs are fair but hard.
not bad quite gd

He is very good. His exams are not easy but this is bell curve , so it is fair.  He is very helpful to his students and encourage people to ask questions during class. One of the best professors I have ever met. He let me rearrange an exam as I have got 3 in a row. Very helpful

VERY tough midterm and exam. Very clear lectures, "from the ground up" approach to the class. Starts basic and works up to cover the text. 
 
 Helpful if approached to a degree. But there are no easy marks for this class.
all depends pn how well you take notes
not bad~ lectures are very clear~ but yes, the exams are tough, pass exams are helpful though~ :)

His exams are hard!! If you wanna get good mark, then gotta study more than what he teaches. Never test on those simple questions. He expects you understand the stuff thoroughly even though he just mentioned it for 4 mins in the class.

Excellent prof. Would not have made it through 336 without him. He is extremely concerned that everyone understands, he wants students to succeed, and he makes the material relevant to any major. Outside class he is even more eager to explain things and help students. Thanks Payman!
The worst prof I ever took a course with. I think he isbetter off do something else rather than teaching.

if you wanna have a great experience knowing what MS is all about, take it with Payman. he knows his stuff very well. and he CARES about your learning. he's the first prof ever that would actually spend the first 30 mins of class reviewing the material he taught last class. exams and grading are fair. highly recommend you to take this fun class.
Couldn't be any clearer when I say DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS. Nothing on the quizzes and HW (which are insanely hard) are shown in his lecture.
avoid at all costs. Doesn't teach you anything just reads slides from the textbook and makes the tests insanely hard. impossible sitting through his 4-hour lectures.
His assessments are crazy hard and time constrained.
Solid professor. There is no reason to get below a B unless you put in no effort.

Exams and assignments were very difficult (due to the nature of this course, not the prof, but I heard his exams were already easier than other professors). Very excel heavy. MAKE SURE TO DO THE SAMPLE MIDTERM (actual midterm was very similar)! Expect to go to open labs often to understand concepts.
He is by far the best professor I've had a course with. He genuinely wants you to learn.

Great prof. Very helpful and available to students outside of class. He pays attention to details and puts effort into getting to know his students and answering to their struggles. Assignments can be tricky, but overall, his marking is fair. Exam questions are (for the most parts) taken directly from class and slide examples.
He is extremely nice and smart. I would absolutely recommend him.

I didn't do so well in this class, but that's on me because I didn't study enough. He is an extremely fair grader and his teaching style is interesting because although I didn't really care to much for the class, he still always caught my attention during class. I would recommend that you have a conversation with him because he will f your mind up.

This guy is a good prof. I usually hate going to class but his lectures were actually interesting and got me fired up. Honestly, i didn't study that much for this class. I just focused during lectures and did the assignments and the practice questions and ended with a B. He also cracks up a couple hilarious jokes during class and has a cool accent.

I don't understand the reviews here saying he's a bad prof and that this class is hard. He is actually one of the best profs I've had at SFU. Also this class is not difficult at all. Just study his lectures and the textbook and do the practice questions. The people who left the bad reviews are just salty cause they didn't study and got bad grades.

Gorkem is a really great prof. He is open to his students and is very engaging during his lectures. His assignments, midterm, and final are very reasonable if you understand the concepts taught in class and do the practice questions. Also, he is one of the rare profs that will actually put in his time to help you if you have any questions.

Personally, I thought Gorkem was a great prof. To those saying that his assignments and exams were difficult to understand are those that just didn't put in the effort to learn the concepts and materials. His exams and assignments are extremely fair and they directly relate to the textbook and the materials taught in class. I would highly recommend
worst prof ever

Grading criteria was 20% assignments 35% midterm 45% final. His first two assignments were impossibly difficult, and the average on the midterm was around 60%. After receiving midterm evaluations, he did end up making the last two assignments and the final significantly easier. Hard to understand at times due to accent but is nice to students.
This professor is the worse prof ever. Workload is crazy, 336 was meant to be a fun course but he manage to ruin the experience of it

I really enjoy taking 336 with Michael! He cares about his students and keeps everything organized. The course is not easy but he makes it easier by giving some examples in class. Make sure to review the textbook and tutorial slides prior to the lecture and do weekly practice questions to keep track of the material.

Michael was a great prof who tried to explain the concepts clearly. However, the marking was left to the TAs and he wasn't very proactive in answering emails. Midterm and final were a bit confusing as everything is now online. Study and pay attention to his lectures
This guy loves coffee, and you should too! He will mention coffee 20+ times in each of his lecture recordings and for you to drink some. Coffee break! literally great teaching skills
Best Prof ever. Just show up, and do all the hw and practice exams he gives. No need for a book and extra questions.
Mike is passionate about statistics and cares a lot about students and wants us to succeed. He has a good sense of humour and very generous in giving marks.
Best prof ever.

I STRONGLY recommend pre-reading before class to get the most out of lecture.  Although he has crystal clear lectures, you will get the most out of it if you do preread, because he goes really fast.  Final was more difficult than the midterm, just make sure you know how to do every single example hes ever gone through (seriously) and youre good.

Michael is great at teaching and makes things easy to understand. However, when asked questions, he gives vague answers, in a way that says 'you should know, so I'm not going to tell you'. His notes have a lot missing and he expects you to know things he didn't teach at all, and they're tested on the midterm. (so read the text and do exercises)
He is a good teacher, but he is arrogant and rude.  Worst prof ever had to talk with.

Mike is an excellent professor. After receiving a B- in BUEC 232, I was really worried about BUS 336. However, based on his passion for the material, excellent teaching ability, and availability to offer assistance, I was able to earn an A in his class. Thank you Mike.
Great prof. Very clear, gives plenty of practice questions. Everything was easy up to the final exam; final was tough. Overall great class with a great prof.

Mike is literally the best professor at SFU!  He made statistics super enjoyable and explained everything really well.  The exams are not crazy difficult, but it's very doable as long as you read the questions carefully and budget your time for each question.  Would take another OM class with him!

There is no professor more passionate that Mike is. Really glad I had the chance to take a class with him during my time at SFU. He is clear in his lectures and makes the content easy to understand. The course itself is pretty tough but if you show up to lectures and do the homework problems before the exams you'll do fine.

Mike is probably the best professor at SFU. His lectures are a must to attend but he is very clear and only tests on lecture material. Just pay attention in class. Also open labs were very useful for help.

He seemed like such an amazing prof, but the minute peer evaluations were done and I went to office hours for questions regarding final, I felt like a ghost. Didn't get appropriate answers, got yesno responses. That so called helpfulness he's so praised about, just disappeared. But during the course he's really helpful. Easy Mt & Hard final

Mike is great; his lectures provide everything you need to know so PAY ATTENTION and take notes properly. He will always say "like I went over in lecture" when you ask him a question. He doesn't take bullcrap tho. Hard work pays off, slackers will surely fail. Exams are very similar to assignments (which can b tricky). Final was brutal for everyone
Good instructor!His funny and helpful.
Definitely recommend taking BUS336 with Mike! Interesting lecture, useful notes. You'll have to attend the lectures in order to get high marks.
Easiest. A I've receieved at SFU. Just go to lectures, do the problem sets and dont make silly mistakes during exams.

Such a good prof! He's super nice and really funny. And there was pretty much no tutorial/lecture for the last three weeks of the semester except to play a game and talk about it. Exams are a bit tricky, but still not too bad. I started this class thinking I was gonna hate it but ended up loving it!

Made a stats class so interesting. Best professor at SFU. Your university life is not complete without being his student once! Class is not hard and exams are fair as long as you study and do his problem sets.
I love micheal! best prof by far at sfu. Made 336 so interesting

Great guy, great class. Midterm was easy, final was tough. Stay on top of the material. The sooner you understand his notes, the better off you'll be for the midterm and final. Assignments are worth much, but useful to work through. Enjoy!
good professor..clear and precise in explaning the material..exams and assignments are reasonable :)
Great prof!!! like him> If he teaches more courses, will definitely take his class
Best business prof at SFU , I dont think there is anyone who doesnt like Mike
Awesome Business Professor @SFU!

He is clear and tries to make it fun. I appreciate his efforts. He is also very helpful and has a great attitude towards the students. He preps well and is very well organized, which helps the learning by logically planning which chapter is better to teach first. One of the best prof at SFU. His exams are quite difficult tho, but real life relevant

If you ever take BUEC 232, make sure to take it with Johnson because he is very approachable and willing to go 1v1 to help you during his office hours. He explains with clarity and keeps you engaged. He's funny and sometimes reminds me of Michael Scott from the office hahaha. Funny how their names are both michael...
This prof is awesome! shows a lot of interest in the class. Not to mention, he's really good looking for his age!

One of the best profs I've had at SFU! His lectures and notes are extremely helpful, and his exams and assignments are fair. Also super nice and funny. He clearly love statistics since he named his son Max after the maximax decision rule.
good prof..

This was the first 300 level course I took, and I was definitely pleasantly surprised. If you are a math/stats person (like myself) you will find the material easy, I got an A+. Mike is a great prof, he usually teaches Operations Mgt. at UBC and has worked in the field so he knows his stuff. FAR better than Eng Choo or whoever teaches this course.

Mike's notes are so clear and concise that you don't even need to read the text. I've never seen such a dedicated professor- he gave up part of his Fathers' Day to do a review session for the midterm. The workload is really light for a 4-credit course; less than a lot of 3-credit courses. No surprises on exams, but do know the videos and Beer Game.
Very enthusiastic, helpful and patience.  Notes and examples were very clear.  Awesome overall!
This class was so fun!  I learned lots and ended up doing well.  Makes me want to do a MS concentration.  Attend all lectures and do the practice problems to do good in the class.

I wish Johnson taught 232. I might have even liked Stats! Johnson is one the best prof's i've had. We never felt rushed; he was very accomodating and generous with grading. The material taught is EXACTLY what will be tested. No surprises. SFU, do one smart thing and steal him from BCIT.

One of the best profs I've ever had.  Really great person, and he really loves what he teaches which makes it even better.  He has a sense of humour and more importantly even came in on the WEEKEND to help out the students.  I've been to four post-secondary schools, with a lot of profs, and he is in my top 3 profs.
One of the best profs I've ever had. Made one of my dreaded courses really fun. He definitely knows his stuff!
The best prof I have ever had! He should be offered a professorship at SFU. Mike is clear, helpful, fun and exciting. Don't miss the beer game!

Professor Johnson is one of the best profs I've ever had. He's very clear, thorough and super enthusiastic about teaching. Never miss lecture as all of his notes are extremely useful and pertinent to exams.
Great prof!! His lectures are very clear and organized. Easy midterm but long...final is fair but tricky!! Highly recommended prof *two thumbs up
Lectures are essential. Mike will walk you thru every single step. He is a funny guy, and he tells you exactly what is expected. Miss lectures at your own peril.

For all those that hhave hheard horror stories about 336, take it with Mike. Makes hard stuff very easy to understand...TA's did mark hard, but the concepts were easy enough to get at least a B wih him! Great Prof!

Mike is a good teacher. The class is purely technical if your good at word problem math you'll be fine. The TA's mark a bit rough, but in all the class was really enjoyable and Mike is a blessing in disguise for a teacher.

Wow. You are TRULY lucky if you have Michael Johnson as your prof for 336. The class is so laid back and he makes 3 hr stat lectures (though usually less than 3) a little more bearable. Good looking and funny!

midterm had one queston on beta value, 3-5 questions on the probability. study that  probability!!i studied 2 weeks ahead for finals...dont have to read the ENTIRE book but just make sure u go thru the notes and do one or two practice examples. the models are really important make sure u know how to write those equations and nodes!

Very easy material. The depth of the material is very surface (compared to STAT 285). Lack of mathmatical proofs = No way for students to truly understand the material (intead of simply memorizing when to use which formula) and apply them later for serious quantitative research. Lectures are long and boring. Labs are too crowded.
Keep avoid him by all cost. the material should be easy but he just makes it hard~! his teaching style is terrible and the lecture is useless and boring.

I can't believe the faculty hires such a bad prof. His lectures are completely useless, you will do much better if you just study by yourself. Take 336 with someone else. I regret wasting time and money on him.

He knows his stuff, but he sucks at teaching it. Assignments rely heavily on Excel, which are useless because they can't be asked in a written exam. Basically you need to guess how he will test you in the exam, and then study by teaching yourself based on his slides which don't give enough detail on what the hell is going on.

Agree with previous comment. This prof don't like to help students with questions. I saw him insult student in the lecture.Assignments are much harder compare to the other 336 class. Teaching is too emotional and speaking is not clear. Not a good professor.
In one word - atrocious. Does SFU Business even care?

In Buec232, Dobson was a clear and entertaining teacher. Yet, in Bus336, I found him to be over repetitive and boring enough to put me to a nap sometimes. Each class should take roughly around 30min to teach at the most, but he spreads it out to a painful 2.5-3 hrs span.  Assignments take around 2 hrs to complete. MT and Final was challenging.

i don't get the previous poster's deal with dobson's accent.90% percent of the students in the class have accents.i think you're just pissed 'cuz you didn't do well.don't blame the prof 'cuz you don't know your stuff.Dobson is clear, focused, structured, entertaining, but does not care for slackers. AWESOME PROF!!!

I thought my final could get 50/50, but i did not. I know his exams are always really tricky and you may never know which Qs you got wrong. Anyway, I got an A again (buec232 also). Easy course, boring class!

Questions on exams were not as easy as they seemed bcuz I got lower than expected.Light workload though.In BUEC 232, I thought he was just over-enthusiastic, but in 336 I found his teaching style even more annoying.By shouting, running around and repeating useless stuff, he makes it complicated.He should have changed his accent instead of his name.

Do not let his Anglo-Saxon name deceive you! He has a very thick accent; I can barely understand him. Lectures are way too long (3hrs). Tutorials useless too. The textbook is amazing though, you can skip 3hr class and learn just as much by reading for 30min. It teaches Excel by steps too (instead of memorizing what TA's do in tutorial).

I am just surprised by all the comments here. Like OMG, i bet all these people are pissed because they never bothered to study and screwed up on the midterm. David is an awesome prof. If you show interest towards what he is teaching, then we will help you to the best of his ability. I agree lectures were BORING but hey, thats stats for you!

Makes easy concepts hard to understand.  Imagine having to turn to an old textbook in order to get clarification on what a PROF is saying, shouldn't it be the other way around?  He tries, I'll give him that- he's just not cut out for teaching.

Oh David. Seems like a nice guy as a quirky uncle or something, but can be a big **** in class, making fun of or getting pissed at students for trivial things. Not a great lecturer, a bit hard to understand, lecturing style is annoying (says the same stuff over and over again). TAs were USELESS and textbook was not needed READ LECTURE NOTES!!!

Absolute psycho in the first half of the course. He literally went from happy one second to yelling at students for minutes because of the dumbest and smallest reasons. He got nicer by the end of the semester after people reported him to the Dean. Sit in the back for a quick exit. You probably won't pay attention for a good chunk.

He was probably one of the worst profs I have encountered in SFU. He goes over his lectures too quickly and he often skipped a bunch! Bus 336 was based on learning excel but he did all the excel stuff too quickly during class. He was horribleeee!

Material is easy enough when he goes over it in class but that's because he teaches in a very glossy sort of way. Do the homework and readings and you should be fine.  Midterm was expected to be easy but was very challenging.

Picks on students EVERY class, always stopping lecture mid session and start screaming at random students for the littlest things.. but hasn't been a real issue for me until he started screaming at me and my friend out of the blue for not having my notebook out and for being "ridiculous, sitting there doing nothing", we weren't even talking!!

First 30 minutes of lecture was boring. Exams were easy. Didn't do any of the questions in the book for exams. Know his notes inside and out. Text was good reference when notes didn't make sense.Final started 35 mins late. 95%+ for A+. If highest is 80, that one person gets A-. Overall, a pretty easy class. Goodluck! =]

MCs exam, each question worth 1% towards the grade. Though it's easy, but you know, the class is curved. He gave lollipops to the evening class, is that bribery? And yeah "TODAY IS A GOOD DAY,IM NOT KIDDING!"

Made 336 look easy. If you think this class is hard, take it with Dobson! Funny guy and is passionate about what he teaches. Always available for help. Midterm wasn't hard or easy either. Just pay attention in class and do you h.w and your looking at a B or B+. He always keep the class laughing and involved. Highly recommended. Love his accent.

I like this guy's enthusiasm and passion for the course. He's right when he says this stuff is useful (he's not kidding). However, like many profs, tends to spend much of his time talking about simple concepts and not enough on the tougher ones which usually come later in his lecture; you'll find the textbook much more useful.

He can be extremely irritating. During the final exam, in the last 20 minutes or so, he said, " I need the z-value table" about probably 200 times. He could've just projected the table up front instead of disturbing the whole class. Easiest class but annoying u know who.

"It's good stuff.  I'm not kidding, honestly."  This guy loves what he's doing and his enthusiasm rubs off on us. He's very encouraging and calls us "champions." His exams are easy and are exactly like the assignments.

He is extremely passionate about the course! He always try to make lectures more interesting and practical. He is eager to help students and always try to interact with them in class. I enjoy his class a lot. Assignments can be very time consuming but midterm was fair.

He loves this subject and is trying to make this course fun and practical. He is a hard working prof. You really can learn something that is useful in the future. Like what he said, this is a "wonderful course".

David Dobson made studying stats fun. I realize that sentence probably hasn't been said before, but he does. He is super energetic and stoked to be teaching stats. Very refreshing to see a prof that enjoys teaching, and his help/work. Don't buy text, just follow his slides and go to tutorials. Even the T.A's tell you the text is almost needless.
The course is easy in Spring 2009 but some of the assignments are harder in the summer because the TAs made those of the assignments. But still, this is an easy 336 session.
He is humourous and keeps lectures interesting. I can follow along and understand what he is teaching (I usually cannot do the same thing in other lectures).

David Dobson is practically impossible to understand; thick accent, and talks fast. He will get mad if you ask for help during office hours, and generally leave you feeling as if you're on your own. The book sucks, and does things differently than he does in class. The TA's I had are helpful, so that was good. Take it with somebody else. Good luck!
